title: MLB DFS Plays: Monday 9/2
text:
This article will outline the best daily fantasy MLB plays of the day at every position. We’ll take a comprehensive look across the DFS industry to uncover these core recommendations, factoring respective salaries into the analysis.

Please note, these player picks were organized early in the day. For MLB contests, always check lineups and weather closer to game time. Rain, wind, or unexpected managerial decisions could open up additional sources of value. Be sure to keep an eye on the MLB Headlines and Injuries desk.

Editor’s Note: Stay ahead of the competition from wire to wire with rankings, customizable projections, trade evaluator, exclusive columns and more in our Season Pass. And start using optimized lineups with our DFS Toolkit!

Scroll to continue with content Ad

We will be looking at the eight-game main afternoon slate starting at 1:05 ET.

PITCHER

Ryan Yarbrough - Tampa Bay (vs. Baltimore)

Yarbrough has looked sharp throughout most of this season, as he currently holds an impressive 3.36 ERA supported by a clean 3.17 FIP. This is a great situation to keep his numbers shiny, facing a Baltimore offense that ranks 23rd in wRC+ and 20th against left-handed pitching. Yarbrough checks in as a strong -270 home favorite as a result, and I’m expecting a quality start to go along with the victory this afternoon.

Also Consider: Kyle Hendricks, Mike Soroka

CATCHER / FIRST BASE

Ji-Man Choi - Tampa Bay (vs. Baltimore)

Story continues

Don’t forget about the Tampa offense either, as they’ll step into an encouraging draw against Asher Wojciechowski and the generous Orioles’ bullpen. Wojciechowski carries a vulnerable .389 wOBA split to left-handed bats, which feeds into Choi’s wheelhouse. The lefty first baseman has picked things up lately with eight hits, two homers, six runs, and five RBIs over his last four starts.

Also Consider: Freddie Freeman, C.J. Cron

SECOND BASE

Addison Russell - Chicago Cubs (vs. Seattle)

The Cubbies hold the highest scoring projection of this slate, and it’s easy to visualize that against Seattle LHP Justus Sheffield - who has allowed 10 earned runs across 11.1 innings through three major league appearances. This sets up for the Cubs to jump all over him, and Russell is a strong candidate to get in on the action alongside Kris Bryant, Javier Baez (if playing), Anthony Rizzo, and Nicholas Castellanos (more on him later).

Also Consider: Ozzie Albies, Kolten Wong

THIRD BASE

Josh Donaldson - Atlanta (vs. Toronto)

I just mentioned how the Cubs represent the highest scoring projection of this slate; well, the Braves aren’t far behind in that regard. They’ll face Toronto RHP Jacob Waguespack’s .368 wOBA split to RHB followed by a non-imposing Jays’ bullpen. Donaldson checks in with a mid-range salary while looking like a strong fantasy candidate in this draw.

Also consider: Kris Bryant, Joey Wendle (punt)

SHORTSTOP

Dansby Swanson - Atlanta (vs. Toronto)

Take the previous write-up of Donaldson and directly apply it to Swanson. Dansby recently came off the injured list, getting back into the thick of things with two hits and three RBIs over his last two games. A breakout fantasy performance looms, and it could certainly come to fruition this afternoon.

Also Consider: Jorge Polanco, Javier Baez (if playing)

OUTFIELD

Eddie Rosario - Minnesota (at Detroit)

It’s pretty crazy that it took this long to mention Minnesota’s “Bomba Squad”, but there are plenty of well-aligned offenses to target on this afternoon slate (CHC, ATL, TB). Rosario is my favorite candidate to add to the Twins’ record-setting home run total while facing the generosity of Detroit RHP Jordan Zimmermann (.354 wOBA vs. LHB).

Nicholas Castellanos - Chicago Cubs (vs. Seattle)

Castellanos checks in as a strong mid-range outfielder who will benefit from the aforementioned draw against Seattle LHP Sheffield. It’s worth selecting several Cubbies in your lineups this afternoon, and Castellanos is one of my favorites in terms of price and expected production.

Also consider: Ronald Acuna, Bryce Harper, Austin Meadows, Corey Dickerson, Dexter Fowler, Jake Cave, Matt Joyce
